channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: What killed Napoleon's army? Scientists find clues in DNA from fallen soldiers' teeth
item.description: In 1812, hundreds of thousands of men in Napoleon's army perished during their retreat from Russia. Researchers now believe a couple of unexpected pat...

item.title: Federal workers go without pay today. And, NBA stars arrested for illegal gambling
item.description: Today, millions of federal workers are missing their first full paycheck since the shutdown began. And, an NBA gambling scandal has led to the arrest ...

item.title: Inflation rose less than expected in September, the U.S. belatedly reports
item.description: The federal government recalled some furloughed workers specifically to produce the inflation report, which plays a key role for Social Security benef...

item.title: Boston bar stirs outrage with its mobster mugshots as decor
item.description: Neighbors say the restaurant is glorifying people like mob boss Whitey Bulger and Stephen "The Rifleman" Flemmi. The bar's owners say they're only rec...

item.title: Argentina's President Milei faces a political reckoning in midterm elections
item.description: Argentina's libertarian president, Javier Milei, faces midterms amid economic chaos and a $20 billion lifeline offer from President Trump.

item.title: Shock at $100,000 fee to contest Guinea elections to replace junta
item.description: The authorities say the high amount is needed to ensure only credible candidates take part.

item.title: US strikes another alleged drug boat in Caribbean
item.description: Defence Secretary Pete Hegseth said the tenth strike in the region targeted the Tren de Aragua cartel.

item.title: Trump administration defends ballroom renovations as lawmakers call for transparency
item.description: The East Wing of the White House, which stood since 1942, has been demolished in just a few days to make way for President Trump's ballroom. Lawmakers...

item.title: National Guard deployments in Washington, DC, and Portland, Oregon, are focus of court hearings
item.description: The deployment of National Guard troops on the streets of Washington faces challenges in two courts on Friday — one in the nation’s capital and anothe...

item.title: Colombia's leader slams U.S. boat strikes as illegal and ineffective
item.description: Colombian President Gustavo Petro gives his side of the story as he engages Trump in a war of words over mounting U.S. boat strikes.

item.title: German police seize fake Picassos in multi-million euro forgery raid
item.description: Authorities say a 77-year-old German tried to sell copies of works by renowned artists such as Rembrandt.

item.title: Trump says tech leaders and mayor changed his mind about using federal force in San Francisco
Brazil's Lula, 79, to seek fourth term as president
item.description: The 79-year-old says he has "the same energy I had when I was 30" as he announces plan to run in 2026.

item.title: 2 men injured by blast as they played with WWII artillery shell
item.description: Two Polish men in their 60s seem to have learned the hard way that handling old WWII shells while intoxicated can have consequences.

item.title: Presidential historian on why Trump's White House renovation isn't the first or the biggest
item.description: As images of the East Wing demolition spark debate, historian Alexis Coe joins "CBS Mornings Plus" to put the latest White House renovation in perspec...

item.title: Canada will restart trade talks when 'Americans are ready', says Carney
item.description: The US president says he is axing negotiations over an advert that used Ronald Reagan speaking negatively about tariffs.

item.title: Police bust plot to sell fake artwork purportedly by Rembrandt, Picasso
item.description: The fake paintings were being offered for between about $465,000 and $150 million, police said in a statement.

item.title: Shots fired at vehicle after it backs into US Coast Guard base in the San Francisco Bay Area
